title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the author say may have an adverse impact on people?

Options.text: Undergoing plastic surgeries in pursuit of beauty.
Imitating the lifestyles of heroes and role models.
Striving to achieve perfection regardless of financial cost.
Attempting to meet society's expectation of appearance.

questionsOne.Statement: What have researchers found out about people's earn-ings?

Options.text: They are closely related to people's social status.
They have to do with people's body weight and shape.
They seem to matter much less to men than to women.
They may not be equal to people's contributions.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the author's recent study focus on?

Options.text: Previous literature on indicators of competitiveness in the workplace.
Traits that matter most in one's pursuit of success in the labor market.
Whether self-perception of body image impacts one's workplace success.
How bosses' perception of body image impacts employees' advancement.

questionsOne.Statement: What is the finding of the author's recent research?

Options.text: Being overweight actually does not do much harm to the overall well-being of employees.
People are not adversely affected in the workplace by false self-perception of body weight.
Self-esteem helps to combat gender inequality in the workplace.
Gender inequality continues to frustrate a lot of female employees.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the author think would help improve the situation in the labor market?

Options.text: Banning discrimination on the basis of employees' body image.
Expanding protection of women against gender discrimination.
Helping employees change their own perception of beauty.
Excluding body shape as a category in the labor contract.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author suggest by saying “The work-life balance is dead”?

Options.text: The hope of achieving a thriving life is impossible to realize.
The pursuit of a fulfilling career involves personal sacrifice.
The imbalance between work and life simply doesn't exist anymore.
The concept of work-life balance contributes little to a fulfilling life.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author say about our use of language?

Options.text: It impacts how we think and behave.
It changes with the passage of time.
It reflects how we communicate.
It differs from person to person.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author say we do in an ideal world?

Options.text: We do work that betters the lives of our families and friends.
We do work that gives us bursts of joy each new day.
We do meaningful work that contributes to society.
We do demanding work that brings our capacity into full play.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author say about life?

Options.text: It is cyclical.
It is dynamic.
It is fulfilling.
It is risky.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the author advise us to do?

Options.text: Make life as simple as possible.
Talk about balance in simpler terms.
Balance life and work in a new way.
Strive for a more fulfilling life.
